availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Franklin Metcalfe (Bracken County, Kentucky, justice of the peace and shoemaker)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, justice of the peace and shoemaker. Kentucky native. Married to Emily Hathaway Metcalfe on November 27, 1831. Father of Sallie Metcalfe, William Metcalfe, Maria Metcalfe, Daniel C. Metcalfe, Henry Metcalfe, Ely P. Metcalfe, Elizabeth Metcalfe, Salina Metcalfe, Emily Metcalfe, Benjamin Metcalfe, Mary E. Metcalfe. Justice of the Peace in Bracken County in 1850. Shoemaker in Bracken County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 472A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 38.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, TH-1-9981-4774-18, Bracken County, November 27, 1831 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film #000344097, p. 244 of 403 on Microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Taliaferro P. Shaffner, ed., The Kentucky State Register, for the Year 1847 (Louisville, KY: Morton & Griswold), 52.
